com.stoyanr.mastermind

Class AbstractIOPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stoyanr.mastermind.AbstractIOPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReaderWriterPlayer

    public abstract class AbstractIOPlayer
extends Object
implements Player
    An abstract Player implementation for "human" players that use I/O streams, such as the console, for interacting with a Game. When starting or ending a game, prints messages to the output device. To provide a score, it first prints a message and then reads two numbers from the input device.

    This class has two protected abstract methods printLine(String, Object...) and readLineInt(String) for the actual low-level I/O operations. All concrete I/O players extending this class should implement these two methods to connect to actual I/O devices, such as a reader/writer or stream pair.

    Author:
    Stoyan Rachev

      Creates a new I/O player with the given game setup.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void endGame(boolean won, int roundsPlayed)
      Prints a message to the output device to inform the user that the game has been won or lost in the given number of rounds.
      Score getScore(String guess)
      First prints a message to the output device to ask the user for a score, and then reads two integer numbers from the input device, first for the "cows" and then for the "bulls".

      Prints the given message to the output device.

      Prints the given message to the output device, and then reads an integer number from the input device.

      • getScore

        public final Score getScore(String guess)
        First prints a message to the output device to ask the user for a score, and then reads two integer numbers from the input device, first for the "cows" and then for the "bulls".
        Specified by:
        getScore in interface Player

        Returns:

        Throws:

        protected abstract int readLineInt(String message)

        Parameters:
        message - The messge to print. Must not have any arguments.
        Returns:
